messageBody:
At 10:19 AM 16/11/01, you wrote:

>you are right about testing the unit but not the flow. But how do you unit
>test an eventdriven, asynchronous JMS client?
>In my case, a client sends a message to a queue, then executes other tasks
>but listens for the arriving of the answer. The server sends back its
>answer into another queue. When the message arrives, the message listener
>activates a certain client method in which then the answer is executed upon.
>How can I test such a scenario with JUnit? All I can imagine is writing
>some "meta" methods for the client which return a value on invoking. In
>this method, the sending, listening and receiving of the method are
>gathered together. Can anybody help with another solution?


You should probably look into mock objects (see the archives for links...)
You could use one to represent the queue, the message... etc. What you
won't be able to do is end-to-end testing - you can only really test the
individual events.
